channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Charles Barkley calls Warriors' Boston crowd callouts 'weak' https://t.co/UJgaSRWlCY
Tesla Model 3 glass roof shows its strength by tanking a falling tree in China. https://t.co/FeyESxQRrl

The tech industry goes through this periodically. Big companies announce vast plans to boil the ocean, to completely turn everything upside down, rip up the pavement, make the streets go in different directions. The press falls for it, but nothing actually happens.
20 million people tuned in to live U.S. television broadcasts of Thursday's hearing by lawmakers probing the 2021 riot at the U.S. Capitol. https://t.co/yxLgpbBFPw
@amazonmusic -- alexa played me a list of songs earlier today and i want to see the list. there were a few songs there that i'd like to hear again. surely it must be possible to see such a list.
@DaveHiott @NatalieReporter totally
It's no secret, Apple's actively working on Car tech. https://t.co/s0VMzJC41o

Of course... Trump wanted everyone in the Capitol on Jan 6 to die. Then he'd pick up all the pieces of a broken nation. That -- I'm sure we'll find out -- if it wasn't the plan, it was his hope. https://t.co/fDHN1iXWKb

"Inflation rose 8.6% in May" is not correct. What they meant to say was prices rose 8.6% over prices in May last year. So it's wrong in two ways, unless they really meant inflation rose 8.6% which wouldn't be particularly bad btw. https://t.co/MsSql7MPyq
@elienyc should definitely do his own show. i'm listening to a he-said-she-said back and forth and the other side is the usual boring crap, and he cuts right to the point.
@davidberger Yes, I know.
Do you think the committee will indict her? https://t.co/hDB1qQGUWL

Why aren't the earliest podcasts on YouTube? They should be. So I uploaded one of the first podcasts, an interview by Chris Lydon of me. It's kind of embarrassing (just listened to it). But it is, as they say, what it is. ðŸ˜€ https://t.co/A8evnLcKff
Up to that point Chris had been an host on WBUR and NPR. I had been a software entrepreneur. We were both new fellows at Harvard in 2003.
We took what we knew and synthesized. If this is interesting, I'll post the other original podcasts on YouTube, see what happens. ;-)

This guy deserves some big prize like a Nobel Prize for understanding wtf journalism is for. https://t.co/JZobSLAfff
@gtconway3d @January6thCmte @TheJusticeDept STOP AMPLIFYING HIM.
